result.execSummary:
The defendant Lasal J Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with credit for 2 days time served; release privileges for work.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lasal J Sanders

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lasal J Sanders in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days time served; release privileges for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.
Conditions: 
*  Possess no firearms;
*  Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Lasal J Sanders in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lasal J Sanders in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lasal J Sanders in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Detective William Sapagian - MPD.  State rests.  Sworn for defense:  Lasal S.  Parties rests.  Evidence is closed.  Findings by Court.  Court denied defense motion.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lasal J Sanders in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for motion hearing.  Defense filed motion today.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment of the motion hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lasal J Sanders in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lasal J Sanders
Current: 1475 N 18th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 02-23-2015)
Prior: 1475 N 18th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Lasal J Sanders in court.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/23/15 @ 1 PM
